original: Theravāda Vinaya
analyzed: thera vāda vinaya
translated: The Pāṭimokkha of the Theravāda Vinaya

original: Mahāvibhaṅga🔽Nissaggiyakaṇḍa🔽Cīvaravagga
analyzed: mahāvibhaṅga  nissaggiya kaṇḍa  cīvara vagga
translated: The Great Analysis🔽The Chapter on Forfeiture

original: 6. Aññātakaviññattisikkhāpada
analyzed: aññātaka viññatti sikkhāpada
translated: The Sub-chapter on Robe-cloth🔽The training rule on asking unrelated people

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.🔽Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto paṭṭo hoti dhammiṁ kathaṁ kātuṁ.🔽Atha kho aññataro seṭṭhiputto yenāyasmā upanando sakyaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ upanandaṁ sakyaputtaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme  tena kho pana samayena āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto paṭṭaḥ hoti dhammim katham kātu  atha kho aññataraḥ seṭṭhi putto yena āyasmā upanandaḥ sakya putto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam upanandam sakya puttam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: In Sāvatthī.🔽At that time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan was skilled at giving teachings.🔽A son of a wealthy merchant went to Upananda, bowed, sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho taṁ seṭṭhiputtaṁ āyasmā upanando sakyaputto dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho tam seṭṭhiputtam āyasmā upanandaḥ sakyaputto dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi
translated: and Upananda taught him the Dhamma.

original: Atha kho so seṭṭhiputto āyasmatā upanandena sakyaputtena dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito āyasmantaṁ upanandaṁ sakyaputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ seṭṭhiputtaḥ āyasmatā upanandena sakya puttena dhammiyā kathāya sandassitaḥ samādapitaḥ samuttejitaḥ sampahasitaḥ āyasmantam upanandam sakya puttam etat avoca
translated: The young man then said to Upananda, “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”🔽

original: “vadeyyātha, bhante, yena attho.
analyzed: vadeyyātha bhante yena attho
translated: The young man then said to Upananda, “Please tell me what you need.

original: Paṭibalā mayaṁ ayyassa dātuṁ yadidaṁ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāran”ti.
analyzed: paṭibalāḥ mayam ayyassa dātum yat idam cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāranti
translated: I’m able to give you a robe, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies.”

original: “Sace me tvaṁ, āvuso, dātukāmosi, ito ekaṁ sāṭakaṁ dehī”ti.
analyzed: sace me tvaḥ āvusaḥ dātu kāmaḥ asi itas ekam sāṭakam dehi iti
translated: “If you want to give me something, then give me this upper robe.”

original: “Amhākaṁ kho, bhante, kulaputtānaṁ kismiṁ viya ekasāṭakaṁ gantuṁ.
analyzed: amhākam kho bhante kula puttānam kismin viya eka sāṭakam gantu
translated: “We respectable people don’t go out in just one robe.

original: Āgamehi, bhante, yāva gharaṁ gacchāmi.
analyzed: āgama ihi bhante yāva gharam gacchāmi
translated: Please wait until I get home.

original: Gharaṁ gato ito vā ekaṁ sāṭakaṁ pahiṇissāmi ito vā sundarataran”ti.
analyzed: gharam gataḥ itas vā ekam sāṭakam pahiṇissāmi itas vā sundarataranti
translated: When I’m home, I’ll either send you this robe or something better.”

original: Dutiyampi kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto taṁ seṭṭhiputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho āyasmai upanandaḥ sakyaputto tam seṭṭhi puttam etat avoca
translated: A second time Upananda said,

original: “sace me tvaṁ, āvuso, dātukāmosi ito ekaṁ sāṭakaṁ dehī”ti.
analyzed: sace me tvaḥ āvusaḥ dātu kāmaḥ asi itas ekam sāṭakam dehi iti
translated: “If you want to give me something, then give me this upper robe.”

original: Amhākaṁ kho bhante kulaputtānaṁ kismiṁ viya ekasāṭakaṁ gantuṁ, āgamehi, bhante yāva gharaṁ gacchāmi, gharaṁ gato ito vā ekaṁ sāṭakaṁ pahiṇissāmi ito vā sundarataranti.
analyzed: amhākam kho bhante kula puttānam kismin viya eka sāṭakam gantu āgamehi bhante yāva gharam gacchāmi gharam gataḥ itas vā ekam sāṭakam pahiṇissāmi itas vā sundarataranti
translated: “Young man, we gentlemen don’t go out in public in a single robe. Please wait until I return home. When I do, I’ll send you either this robe or one even better.”

original: Tatiyampi kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto taṁ seṭṭhiputtaṁ etadavoca—🔽“sace me tvaṁ, āvuso, dātukāmosi, ito ekaṁ sāṭakaṁ dehī”ti.🔽Amhākaṁ kho, bhante, kulaputtānaṁ kismiṁ viya ekasāṭakaṁ gantuṁ, āgamehi, bhante yāva gharaṁ gacchāmi, gharaṁ gato ito vā ekaṁ sāṭakaṁ pahiṇissāmi ito vā sundarataranti.
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho āyasmai upanandaḥ sakyaputto tam seṭṭhi puttam etat avoca  sace me tvaḥ āvusaḥ dātu kāmaḥ asi itas ekam sāṭakam dehi iti  amhākam kho bhante kula puttānam kismin viya eka sāṭakam gantu āgamehi bhante yāva gharam gacchāmi gharam gataḥ itas vā ekam sāṭakam pahiṇissāmi itas vā sundarataranti
translated: For a third time, Upananda said the same thing,🔽and for a third time the merchant’s son replied in the same way.

original: “Kiṁ pana tayā, āvuso, adātukāmena pavāritena yaṁ tvaṁ pavāretvā na desī”ti.
analyzed: kim pana tayā āvuso a dātu kāmena pavāritena yam tvam pavāretvā na desi iti
translated: “But why did you invite me if you didn’t want to give me anything?”

original: Atha kho so seṭṭhiputto āyasmatā upanandena sakyaputtena nippīḷiyamāno ekaṁ sāṭakaṁ datvā agamāsi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ seṭṭhiputtaḥ āyasmatā upanandena sakyaputtena nippīḍiyamānaḥ ekam sāṭakam da tvā agamāsi
translated: And because he was pressured by Upananda, he gave him a robe and left.

original: Manussā taṁ seṭṭhiputtaṁ etadavocuṁ—“kissa tvaṁ, ayyo, ekasāṭako āgacchasī”ti?
analyzed: manussā tam seṭṭhi puttam etat avocuḥ kissa tva ayyaḥ eka sāṭakaḥ āgacchasi iti
translated: The people said to the young man, “Why are you coming back wearing just one robe?”

original: Atha kho so seṭṭhiputto tesaṁ manussānaṁ etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho so seṭṭhiputto tesam manussānam etam attham ārocesi
translated: He told them what had happened.

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The people complained and criticized him,

original: “mahicchā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā asantuṭṭhā.
analyzed: mahicchāḥ ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyāḥ a santuṭṭhā
translated: “These Sakyan monastics are greedy and not content.

original: Nayimesaṁ sukarā dhammanimantanāpi kātuṁ.
analyzed: sukarā
translated: It’s hard to give them anything.

original: Kathañhi nāma seṭṭhiputtena dhammanimantanāya kayiramānāya sāṭakaṁ gahessantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma seṭṭhiputtena dhamma nimantanāya kayiramānāya sāṭakam gahessanti iti
translated: How could they accept a robe when a young man was making one for them?”

original: Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tesaṁ manussānaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhū tesam manussānam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentāna
translated: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

original: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto seṭṭhiputtaṁ cīvaraṁ viññāpessatī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma āyasmai upanandaḥ sakyaputto seṭṭhi puttam cīvaram viññāpessati iti
translated: “How could Venerable Upananda ask for a robe from a young man?”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṁ upanandaṁ sakyaputtaṁ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantam upanandam sakya puttam aneka pariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Upananda:🔽“Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

original: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, upananda, seṭṭhiputtaṁ cīvaraṁ viññāpesī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira tvam upananda seṭṭhi puttam cīvaram viññāpesi iti
translated: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: “Ñātako te, upananda, aññātako”ti?
analyzed: ñātako te upananda aññātako ti
translated: “Was he a relative of yours?”

original: “Aññātako, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: aññātakaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: “No, Sir.”

original: “Aññātako, moghapurisa, aññātakassa na jānāti patirūpaṁ vā appatirūpaṁ vā santaṁ vā asantaṁ vā.
analyzed: aññātakaḥ moghapurisa aññātakassa na jānāti patirūpam vā appatirūpam vā santam vā asantam vā
translated: “Foolish man, a non-relative doesn’t know what’s appropriate and inappropriate, what’s good and bad, in dealing with a non-relative.

original: Tattha nāma tvaṁ, moghapurisa, aññātakaṁ seṭṭhiputtaṁ cīvaraṁ viññāpessasi.
analyzed: tattha nāma tva mogha purisa aññātakam seṭṭhi puttam cīvaram viññāpessasi
translated: And still you asked a non-relative for robe-cloth.

original: Netaṁ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: neta moghapurisa appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: Foolish man, this neither inspires faith in the faithless …”

original: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: And he laid down the following training rule:

original: “Yo pana bhikkhu aññātakaṁ gahapatiṁ vā gahapatāniṁ vā cīvaraṁ viññāpeyya, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyan”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ pana bhikkhu aññātakam gahapatim vā gahapatānim vā cīvaram viññāpeyya nissaggiyam pācittiyan ti
translated: ‘If a monk asks a non-relative for robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

original: Evañcidaṁ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññattaṁ hoti.
analyzed: evañca idam bhagavatā bhikkhūnam sikkhāpadam paññattam hoti
translated: The Buddha gave a teaching, and then he dismissed the monks, saying, “Monks, you may go.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū sāketā sāvatthiṁ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti. Antarāmagge corā nikkhamitvā te bhikkhū acchindiṁsu.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sambahulāḥ bhikkhū sāketā sāvatthim addhāna magga ppaṭipannāḥ honti antarāmagge corāḥ nikkhamitvā te bhikkhū
translated: At that time a number of monks were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī. On the way, they were robbed by bandits.

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū—“bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṁ aññātakaṁ gahapatiṁ vā gahapatāniṁ vā cīvaraṁ viññāpetun”ti, kukkuccāyantā na viññāpesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavatā paṭikkhittam aññātakam gahapatim vā gahapatānim vā cīvaram viññāpetunti kukkuccāyantāḥ na viññāpesu
translated: Because the Buddha had prohibited them from asking for robes from householders who are not relatives, they were afraid of wrongdoing and did not ask.

original: Yathānaggāva sāvatthiṁ gantvā bhikkhū abhivādenti.
analyzed: yathā anaggāḥ va sāvatthim gantvā bhikkhū abhivādenti
translated: They then went to Sāvatthī and bowed down to the monks.

original: Bhikkhū evamāhaṁsu—“sundarā kho ime, āvuso, ājīvakā ye ime bhikkhūsu abhivādentī”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhū evam āha su sundarā kho ime āvuso ājīvakāḥ ye ime bhikkhūsu abhivādenti iti
translated: The monks said, “It’s good that these Ājīvaka ascetics are bowing down to the monks.”

original: Te evamāhaṁsu—“na mayaṁ, āvuso, ājīvakā, bhikkhū mayan”ti.
analyzed: te evam āha suna mayaḥ āvuso ājīvakā bhikkhū
translated: The monks replied, “We’re not Ājīvaka ascetics, we’re monks.”

original: Bhikkhū āyasmantaṁ upāliṁ etadavocuṁ—“iṅghāvuso upāli, ime anuyuñjāhī”ti.🔽Atha kho āyasmatā upālinā anuyuñjiyamānā te bhikkhū etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ. Atha kho
analyzed: bhikkhū āyasmantam upālim etat avocuḥ iṅgha āvuso upāli ime anuyuñjāhi iti 🔽atha kho āyasmatā upālinā anuyuñjiyamānā te bhikkhū etam attham ārocesu atha kho
translated: The monks said to Venerable Upāli, “Please investigate this.”🔽Upāli did so,

original: āyasmā upāli te bhikkhū anuyuñjitvā bhikkhū etadavoca—“bhikkhū ime, āvuso. Detha nesaṁ cīvarānī”ti.
analyzed: āyasman upāli te bhikkhū anuyuñjitvā bhikkhū etat avoca bhikkhū ime āvuso detha nesam cīvarāni iti
translated: “They’re monks, Venerables. Give them robe-cloth.”

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

original: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū naggā āgacchissanti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma bhikkhū naggāḥ āgacchissanti
translated: “How can monks come naked?

original: Nanu nāma tiṇena vā paṇṇena vā paṭicchādetvā āgantabban”ti.
analyzed: nanu nāma tiṇena vā paṇṇena vā paṭicchādetvā āgantabbanti
translated: Shouldn’t they cover themselves with grass or leaves?”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū te anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū te aneka pariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

original: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, acchinnacīvarassa vā naṭṭhacīvarassa vā aññātakaṁ gahapatiṁ vā gahapatāniṁ vā cīvaraṁ viññāpetuṁ.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave acchinna cīvarassa vā naṭṭha cīvarassa vā aññātakam gahapatim vā gahapatānim vā cīvaram viññāpetu
translated: “Monks, if your robe is stolen or lost, I allow you to ask an unrelated householder for robe-cloth.

original: Yaṁ āvāsaṁ paṭhamaṁ upagacchati, sace tattha hoti saṅghassa vihāracīvaraṁ vā uttarattharaṇaṁ vā bhūmattharaṇaṁ vā bhisicchavi vā, taṁ gahetvā pārupituṁ ‘labhitvā odahissāmī’ti.
analyzed: yam āvāsam paṭhamam upagacchati sace tattha hoti saṅghassa vihāra cīvaram vā uttara tharaṇam vā bhūma tharaṇam vā bhisi chavi vā tam gahetvā pārupitum labhitvā odahissāmi iti
translated: If there is a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, and it has a robe or an upper robe or a ground-covering or a bed-covering, he should take it, thinking, ‘I will use it and then store it.’🔽If there is no dwelling belonging to the Sangha, he should cover himself with grass or leaves, thinking, ‘I will go after covering myself.’

original: No ce hoti saṅghassa vihāracīvaraṁ vā uttarattharaṇaṁ vā bhūmattharaṇaṁ vā bhisicchavi vā tiṇena vā paṇṇena vā paṭicchādetvā āgantabbaṁ; na tveva naggena āgantabbaṁ.
analyzed: no ce hoti saṅghassa vihāra cīvaram vā uttara tharaṇam vā bhūma tharaṇam vā bhisi chavi vā tiṇena vā paṇṇena vā paṭicchādetvā āgantabba na tu eva naggena āgantabba
translated: He should not go uncovered.

original: Yo āgaccheyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ āgaccheyya āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If he goes, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: “And, monks, the training rule should be recited like this:

original: “Yo pana bhikkhu aññātakaṁ gahapatiṁ vā gahapatāniṁ vā cīvaraṁ viññāpeyya, aññatra samayā, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Tatthāyaṁ samayo—acchinnacīvaro vā hoti bhikkhu naṭṭhacīvaro vā.
analyzed: yaḥ pana bhikkhu aññātakam gahapatim vā gahapatānim vā cīvaram viññāpeyya aññatra samayā nissaggiyam pācittiya  tattha ayam samayaḥ acchinna cīvaraḥ vā hoti bhikkhu naṭṭha cīvaraḥ vā
translated: ‘If a monk asks an unrelated male or female householder for a robe, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: Ayaṁ tattha samayo”ti.
analyzed: ayam tattha samayaḥ iti
translated: These are the appropriate occasions: his robe has been stolen or his robe has been lost.’”

original: Yo panāti
analyzed: yaḥ panāti
translated: If a monk:

original: yo yādiso …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ya ādisaḥ pe
translated: if he is such and such …

original: bhikkhūti
analyzed: bhikkhū ti
translated: a monk:

original: …pe… ayaṁ imasmiṁ atthe adhippeto bhikkhūti.
analyzed: pe ayam imasmin atthe adhippetaḥ bhikkhu iti
translated: … the meaning is: a monk as above.

original: Aññātako nāma
analyzed: aññātakaḥ nāma
translated: A stranger:

original: mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddho.
analyzed: mātitaḥ vā pititaḥ vā yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā asambaddhaḥ
translated: on the mother’s or the father’s side, he is not related by birth or marriage up to the seventh generation.

original: Gahapati nāma
analyzed: gahapati nāma
translated: A householder:

original: yo koci agāraṁ ajjhāvasati.
analyzed: yaḥ koci agāram ajjhāvasati
translated: any man who lives in a house.

original: Gahapatānī nāma
analyzed: gahapatānī nāma
translated: A householder’s wife:

original: yā kāci agāraṁ ajjhāvasati.
analyzed: yā kāci agāram ajjhāvasati
translated: any woman who lives in a house.

original: Cīvaraṁ nāma
analyzed: cīvaram nāma
translated: A robe:

original: channaṁ cīvarānaṁ aññataraṁ cīvaraṁ vikappanupagaṁ pacchimaṁ.
analyzed: channam cīvarānam aññataram cīvaram vikappana upagam pacchima
translated: one of the six kinds of robes, suitable for a monastic robe, the last one being “robes made of pieces of cloth”.

original: Aññatra samayāti
analyzed: aññatra samayā ati
translated: Except on an appropriate occasion:

original: ṭhapetvā samayaṁ.
analyzed: samaya
translated: apart from an appropriate occasion.

original: Acchinnacīvaro nāma
analyzed: a chinna cīvaraḥ nāma
translated: His robe has been stolen:

original: bhikkhussa cīvaraṁ acchinnaṁ hoti rājūhi vā corehi vā dhuttehi vā, yehi kehici vā acchinnaṁ hoti.
analyzed: bhikkhussa cīvaram acchinnam hoti rājūhi vā corehi vā dhuttehi vā yehi kehici vā acchinnam hoti
translated: his robe has been stolen by kings, thieves, or scoundrels, or by anyone else.

original: Naṭṭhacīvaro nāma
analyzed: naṭṭhacīvaraḥ nāma
translated: His robe has been lost:
